textBox.richText: Member of the biometric team from October 2017 to ---. PostDoc on secured face recognition (ie. face presentation attack detection). Involved in the project IARPA ODIN BATL. Anjith George is currently pursuing Ph.D. from a Department of Electrical Engineering, IIT Kharagpur, India. His thesis work focuses on image-based eye gaze tracking and its applications such as biometric identification and activity recognition. He has developed algorithms for low-cost eye gaze tracking in desktop as well as wearable scenarios. He has proposed and implemented a novel eye movement based biometrics identification algorithm. In his master's work, he has developed algorithms for driver drowsiness detection in automotive environments. His current research interests include Computer vision, deep learning, biometrics, and image processing. He is gearing up to work on secured face recognition where spoofing attacks can be preemptively addressed.
